get.description: Returns all quick expenses owned by the user.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start of the page offset.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return (default 25).

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The login ID of the user. Optional. The user must have the Web Services Admin (Professional) or Can Administer (Standard) user role to use this parameter.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The quick expense object to be created.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The login ID of the user. Optional. The user must have the Web Services Admin (Professional) or Can Administer (Standard) user role to use this parameter.

get.summary: Get a single quick expense by ID
get.description: Returns a quick expenses by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the quick expense.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The login ID of the user. Optional. The user must have the Web Services Admin (Professional) or Can Administer (Standard) user role to use this parameter.

put.summary: Update a quick expense by ID
put.description: Updates the QuickExpense specified in the URL.  Only the fields provided in the supplied object will be updated, missing fields will not be altered.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the quick expense.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Partial or complete QuickExpense object to update

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The login ID of the user. Optional. The user must have the Web Services Admin (Professional) or Can Administer (Standard) user role to use this parameter.

delete.summary: Delete a quick expense by ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the quick expense to be deleted.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The login ID of the user. Optional. The user must have the Web Services Admin (Professional) or Can Administer (Standard) user role to use this parameter.

Comment.description: A comment that describes the expense. Max Length: 2000

CurrencyCode.description: The 3-letter ISO 4217 currency code for the expense transaction amount. Example: USD

ExpenseTypeCode.description: The code for the expense type in the company’s expense management system. Currently supports Concur Expense codes. The Expense Type Code is returned in the ExpKey element of the Get Expense Group Configuration function response.

ExpenseTypeName.description: The name of the expense type associated with the quick expense.

ID.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

LocationName.description: The name of the location where the expense was incurred.

OwnerLoginID.description: The Concur login ID for the expense owner. Useful for system to system integration when there are expenses for multiple users.

OwnerName.description: The first and last name for the expense owner. Useful for system to system integration when there are expenses for multiple users.

PaymentTypeCode.description: This element specifies the method of payment for the expense. Format: CASHX = Cash, CPAID = Company Paid, or PENDC = Pending Card Transaction (default)

ReceiptImageID.description: The ID of the receipt image associated with this quick expense, if any.

TransactionAmount.description: The total amount of the expense in the original currency, with up to three decimal places. Example: 123.654

TransactionDate.description: The date the expense was incurred. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

VendorDescription.description: The descriptive text for the vendor for the quick expense. This often matches the Merchant Name found in a credit card transaction.  Max Length: 64

ExpenseTypeCode.description: The code for the expense type in the company’s expense management system. Currently supports Concur Expense codes. The Expense Type Code is returned in the ExpKey element of the Get Expense Group Configuration function response.

LocationCity.description: The name of the city where the expense was incurred.

LocationCountry.description: The name of the country where the expense was incurred.
